intro: Henckelia oblonga, commonly known as the slender henckelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals, and are clustered in racemes. Henckelia oblonga is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
